00056 int BLI_getInstallationDir(char * str)
00057 {
00058     char dir[FILE_MAXDIR];
00059     int a;
00060     /*change to utf support*/
00061     GetModuleFileName(NULL,str,FILE_MAX);
00062     BLI_split_dir_part(str, dir, sizeof(dir)); /* shouldn't be relative */
00063     a = strlen(dir);
00064     if (dir[a-1] == '\\') dir[a-1]=0;
00065     
00066     strcpy(str,dir);
00067     
00068     return 1;
00069 }

00071 void RegisterBlendExtension_Fail(HKEY root)
00072 {
00073     printf("failed\n");
00074     if (root)
00075         RegCloseKey(root);
00076     if (!G.background)
00077         MessageBox(0,"Could not register file extension.","Blender error",MB_OK|MB_ICONERROR);
00078     TerminateProcess(GetCurrentProcess(),1);
00079 }
00080 
00081 void RegisterBlendExtension(void)
00082 {
00083     LONG lresult;
00084     HKEY hkey = 0;
00085     HKEY root = 0;
00086     BOOL usr_mode = FALSE;
00087     DWORD dwd = 0;
00088     char buffer[256];
00089 
00090     char BlPath[MAX_PATH];
00091     char InstallDir[FILE_MAXDIR];
00092     char SysDir[FILE_MAXDIR];
00093     const char *ThumbHandlerDLL;
00094     char RegCmd[MAX_PATH*2];
00095     char MBox[256];
00096     BOOL IsWOW64;
00097 
00098     printf("Registering file extension...");
00099     GetModuleFileName(0,BlPath,MAX_PATH);
00100 
00101     // root is HKLM by default
00102     lresult = RegOpenKeyEx(HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, "Software\\Classes", 0, KEY_ALL_ACCESS, &root);
00103     if (lresult != ERROR_SUCCESS) {
00104         // try HKCU on failure
00105         usr_mode = TRUE;
00106         lresult = RegOpenKeyEx(HKEY_CURRENT_USER, "Software\\Classes", 0, KEY_ALL_ACCESS, &root);
00107         if (lresult != ERROR_SUCCESS)
00108             RegisterBlendExtension_Fail(0);
00109     }
00110 
00111     lresult = RegCreateKeyEx(root, "blendfile", 0,
00112         NULL, REG_OPTION_NON_VOLATILE, KEY_ALL_ACCESS, NULL, &hkey, &dwd);
00113     if (lresult == ERROR_SUCCESS) {
00114         strcpy(buffer,"Blender File");
00115         lresult = RegSetValueEx(hkey, NULL, 0, REG_SZ, (BYTE*)buffer, strlen(buffer) + 1);
00116         RegCloseKey(hkey);
00117     }
00118     if (lresult != ERROR_SUCCESS)
00119         RegisterBlendExtension_Fail(root);
00120 
00121     lresult = RegCreateKeyEx(root, "blendfile\\shell\\open\\command", 0,
00122         NULL, REG_OPTION_NON_VOLATILE, KEY_ALL_ACCESS, NULL, &hkey, &dwd);
00123     if (lresult == ERROR_SUCCESS) {
00124         sprintf(buffer, "\"%s\" \"%%1\"", BlPath);
00125         lresult = RegSetValueEx(hkey, NULL, 0, REG_SZ, (BYTE*)buffer, strlen(buffer) + 1);
00126         RegCloseKey(hkey);
00127     }
00128     if (lresult != ERROR_SUCCESS)
00129         RegisterBlendExtension_Fail(root);
00130 
00131     lresult = RegCreateKeyEx(root, "blendfile\\DefaultIcon", 0,
00132         NULL, REG_OPTION_NON_VOLATILE, KEY_ALL_ACCESS, NULL, &hkey, &dwd);
00133     if (lresult == ERROR_SUCCESS) {
00134         sprintf(buffer, "\"%s\",1", BlPath);
00135         lresult = RegSetValueEx(hkey, NULL, 0, REG_SZ, (BYTE*)buffer, strlen(buffer) + 1);
00136         RegCloseKey(hkey);
00137     }
00138     if (lresult != ERROR_SUCCESS)
00139         RegisterBlendExtension_Fail(root);
00140 
00141     lresult = RegCreateKeyEx(root, ".blend", 0,
00142         NULL, REG_OPTION_NON_VOLATILE, KEY_ALL_ACCESS, NULL, &hkey, &dwd);
00143     if (lresult == ERROR_SUCCESS) {
00144         sprintf(buffer, "%s", "blendfile");
00145         lresult = RegSetValueEx(hkey, NULL, 0, REG_SZ, (BYTE*)buffer, strlen(buffer) + 1);
00146         RegCloseKey(hkey);
00147     }
00148     if (lresult != ERROR_SUCCESS)
00149         RegisterBlendExtension_Fail(root);
00150     
00151     BLI_getInstallationDir(InstallDir);
00152     GetSystemDirectory(SysDir,FILE_MAXDIR);
00153 #ifdef WIN64
00154     ThumbHandlerDLL = "BlendThumb64.dll";
00155 #else
00156     IsWow64Process(GetCurrentProcess(),&IsWOW64);
00157     if (IsWOW64 == TRUE)
00158         ThumbHandlerDLL = "BlendThumb64.dll";
00159     else
00160         ThumbHandlerDLL = "BlendThumb.dll";
00161 #endif  
00162     snprintf(RegCmd,MAX_PATH*2,"%s\\regsvr32 /s \"%s\\%s\"",SysDir,InstallDir,ThumbHandlerDLL);
00163     system(RegCmd);
00164 
00165     RegCloseKey(root);
00166     printf("success (%s)\n",usr_mode ? "user" : "system");
00167     if (!G.background) {
00168         sprintf(MBox,"File extension registered for %s.",usr_mode ? "the current user. To register for all users, run as an administrator" : "all users");
00169         MessageBox(0,MBox,"Blender",MB_OK|MB_ICONINFORMATION);
00170     }
00171     TerminateProcess(GetCurrentProcess(),0);
00172 }
00173 
00174 DIR *opendir (const char *path)
00175 {
00176     wchar_t *path_16 = alloc_utf16_from_8(path, 0);
00177 
00178     if (GetFileAttributesW(path_16) & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY) {
00179         DIR *newd= MEM_mallocN(sizeof(DIR), "opendir");
00180 
00181         newd->handle = INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE;
00182         sprintf(newd->path, "%s\\*",path);
00183         
00184         newd->direntry.d_ino= 0;
00185         newd->direntry.d_off= 0;
00186         newd->direntry.d_reclen= 0;
00187         newd->direntry.d_name= NULL;
00188         
00189         free(path_16);
00190         return newd;
00191     }
00192     else {
00193         free(path_16);
00194         return NULL;
00195     }
00196 }
00197 
00198 static char *BLI_alloc_utf_8_from_16(wchar_t *in16, size_t add)
00199 {
00200     size_t bsize = count_utf_8_from_16(in16);
00201     char *out8 = NULL;
00202     if (!bsize) return NULL;
00203     out8 = (char*)MEM_mallocN(sizeof(char) * (bsize + add),"UTF-8 String");
00204     conv_utf_16_to_8(in16,out8, bsize);
00205     return out8;
00206 }
00207 
00208 static wchar_t *UNUSED_FUNCTION(BLI_alloc_utf16_from_8)(char *in8, size_t add)
00209 {
00210     size_t bsize = count_utf_16_from_8(in8);
00211     wchar_t *out16 = NULL;
00212     if (!bsize) return NULL;
00213     out16 =(wchar_t*) MEM_mallocN(sizeof(wchar_t) * (bsize + add), "UTF-16 String");
00214     conv_utf_8_to_16(in8,out16, bsize);
00215     return out16;
00216 }

00220 struct dirent *readdir(DIR *dp)
00221 {
00222     if (dp->direntry.d_name) {
00223         MEM_freeN(dp->direntry.d_name);
00224         dp->direntry.d_name= NULL;
00225     }
00226         
00227     if (dp->handle==INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
00228         wchar_t *path_16 = alloc_utf16_from_8(dp->path, 0);
00229         dp->handle= FindFirstFileW(path_16, &(dp->data));
00230         free(path_16);
00231         if (dp->handle==INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
00232             return NULL;
00233             
00234         dp->direntry.d_name= BLI_alloc_utf_8_from_16(dp->data.cFileName, 0);
00235         
00236         return &dp->direntry;
00237     }
00238     else if (FindNextFileW (dp->handle, &(dp->data))) {
00239         dp->direntry.d_name= BLI_alloc_utf_8_from_16(dp->data.cFileName,0);
00240 
00241         return &dp->direntry;
00242     }
00243     else {
00244         return NULL;
00245     }
00246 }
00247 
00248 int closedir (DIR *dp)
00249 {
00250     if (dp->direntry.d_name) MEM_freeN(dp->direntry.d_name);
00251     if (dp->handle!=INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) FindClose(dp->handle);
00252 
00253     MEM_freeN(dp);
00254     
00255     return 0;
00256 }
00257 
00258 void get_default_root(char *root)
00259 {
00260     char str[MAX_PATH+1];
00261     
00262     /* the default drive to resolve a directory without a specified drive 
00263      * should be the Windows installation drive, since this was what the OS
00264      * assumes. */
00265     if (GetWindowsDirectory(str,MAX_PATH+1)) {
00266         root[0] = str[0];
00267         root[1] = ':';
00268         root[2] = '\\';
00269         root[3] = '\0';
00270     }
00271     else {
00272         /* if GetWindowsDirectory fails, something has probably gone wrong, 
00273          * we are trying the blender install dir though */
00274         if (GetModuleFileName(NULL,str,MAX_PATH+1)) {
00275             printf("Error! Could not get the Windows Directory - Defaulting to Blender installation Dir!");
00276             root[0] = str[0];
00277             root[1] = ':';
00278             root[2] = '\\';
00279             root[3] = '\0';
00280         }
00281         else {
00282             DWORD tmp;
00283             int i;
00284             int rc = 0;
00285             /* now something has gone really wrong - still trying our best guess */
00286             printf("Error! Could not get the Windows Directory - Defaulting to first valid drive! Path might be invalid!");
00287             tmp= GetLogicalDrives();
00288             for (i=2; i < 26; i++) {
00289                 if ((tmp>>i) & 1) {
00290                     root[0] = 'a'+i;
00291                     root[1] = ':';
00292                     root[2] = '\\';
00293                     root[3] = '\0';
00294                     if (GetFileAttributes(root) != 0xFFFFFFFF) {
00295                         rc = i;
00296                         break;          
00297                     }
00298                 }
00299             }
00300             if (0 == rc) {
00301                 printf("ERROR in 'get_default_root': can't find a valid drive!");
00302                 root[0] = 'C';
00303                 root[1] = ':';
00304                 root[2] = '\\';
00305                 root[3] = '\0';
00306             }
00307         }       
00308     }
00309 }
00310 
00311 int check_file_chars(char *filename)
00312 {
00313     char *p = filename;
00314     while (*p) {
00315         switch (*p) {
00316             case ':':
00317             case '?':
00318             case '*':
00319             case '|':
00320             case '\\':
00321             case '/':
00322             case '\"':
00323                 return 0;
00324                 break;
00325         }
00326 
00327         p++;
00328     }
00329     return 1;
00330 }

00332 /* Copied from http://sourceware.org/ml/newlib/2005/msg00248.html */
00333 /* Copyright 2005 Shaun Jackman
00334  * Permission to use, copy, modify, and distribute this software
00335  * is freely granted, provided that this notice is preserved.
00336  */
00337 #include <string.h>
00338 const char *dirname(char *path)
00339 {
00340     char *p;
00341     if ( path == NULL || *path == '\0' )
00342         return ".";
00343     p = path + strlen(path) - 1;
00344     while ( *p == '/' ) {
00345         if ( p == path )
00346             return path;
00347         *p-- = '\0';
00348     }
00349     while ( p >= path && *p != '/' )
00350         p--;
00351     return
00352         p < path ? "." :
00353         p == path ? "/" :
00354         (*p = '\0', path);
00355 }
